review: I bought this for my dad, since he's semi - retiring (going from 7 to 2 days a week) and he loves it. It's great because he doesn't have a game system to use as a platform. The Chromecast wasn't an option because he doesn't have a smart phone, and isn't that technologically inclined to use my laptop. It's very similar to a menu like OnDemand, which is simple to follow. We haven't had any trouble with the connection. I'm very happy with this purchase.

review: Prior to me ordering this, I had purchased the Roku. I took Roku back. It cost more but did not offer all the features. Also with Roku the remote did not work very well. author: Alec05

review: We decided to cut the cord and use Sling TV for ESPN, AMC and other channels, Amazon Prime for movies and other tv, plus an antennae for local channels.  We used a deal through Sling for a "free" Fire stick in exchange for prepaying three months of that service.  We had a miserable time trying to watch NCAA basketball on ESPN/TBS via Sling and faced big delays, and catching up or buffering errors watching any programming.  There was a huge lag to switch channels and several basketball games were impossible to follow due to buffering.  The last straw was buffering throughout the Mad Men episodes that started a few weeks ago.  We thought the problem was Sling or our wireless connection but read about Roku's faster processor.  We set up the Roku 2 today and it is an unbelievable difference! The picture is sharper, there are NO lags, no buffering, no pixelation, even with LIVE sports.  I cannot recommend the Fire stick at all and would return it if I could.  Because we got it through the Sling deal, however, I  unfortunately can't get my money back and get a credit against the Roku cost instead.  I highly recommend getting a Roku 2 (for which Sling also provides deals).
author: Cariop

review: HORRIBLE. biggest waste of time and money. I have comcast high speed internet on a secure network. My firestick is not even 10 feet from my router. It constantly has to stop and load through an episode or movie. I have tried to restart or unplug the firestick as well as my wireless modem and it still lags.
author: Adam white

review: I got this product as a gift. I have used many other streaming services. Such as Google Chrome cast, Roku, and Netgear. But this by far is the worst out of all devices I have used. It frequently crashes tells me that I have poor signal strength and simply won't work at various times during the day. I'll check my Internet connections. I am getting 30 Mb down I believe simply Amazon is not capable of delivering a compelling or Worthwild device at this time.
author: paul daniels

review: Apple TV is much better. I have both and with the Fire Stick it never seems to connect. It always says it encounters problems or can't find an Internet connection. I can hardly ever watch Netflix on it. I love my Amazon Prime membership and thought this would be a great way to watch the shows, but it wasn't worth the money. I loved the game controller, but the kids don't play the games, so I use it for a remote. I spend more time trying to get it to work than I do watching a show. I have also found that a lot of shows I want to watch I have to pay for. I will probably just buy a second Apple TV for the other room.
